jobDescription: Data Scientist IUnited States |  Irvine,  California  Job ID: 20625Job DescriptionPosition at Ingram MicroIngram Micro touches 80% of the technology you use every day with our focus on Technology Solutions, Cloud, and Commerce and Lifecycle Solutions. With $43 billion in revenue, we have become the world’s largest technology distributor with operations in 56 countries and more than 30,000 associates. We continue to strategically expand our global reach with 32 acquisitions since 2012. We are seeking a candidate to develop statistical, machine learning, economic, geographic, and mathematical models to address complex business problems in the tech and ecommerce space.  You will work with the Advanced Science Lab, reporting to a Director with a Ph.D. in Economics, to build causal and predictive models, design and execute field experiments, model demand, design and conduct surveys, perform supply chain optimization, and develop state of the art machine learning and AI models.  The role will collaborate with a diverse team of highly talented Ph.D.s, Masters, and industry experts to use advanced scientific techniques on a world class data infrastructure to develop large-scale models with immediate relevance. You will focus on new product development projects as well as existing internal and external projects. Effective communication with cross-functional teams is required. The role will maintain a broad understanding of Ingram Micro’s business model along with becoming educated on particular vendors, customers, as well as internal division’s business models and needs.
